title: Hashtag in the status gives redscreen on Android emulator
body:
[comment]: # (Please replace ... with your information. Remove < and >)

### User Story



### Description

[comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug)
*Type*: Bug

[comment]: # (Describe the feature you would like, or briefly summarise the bug and what you did, what you expected to happen, and what actually happens. Sections below)
*Summary*: 

Red screen with mention  `One of the sources for assign has an enumerable key on the prototype chain. Are you trying to assign a prototype property? We don't allow it, as this is an edge case that we do not support. This error is a performance optimization and not spec compliant.` appears when there is a hashtag in the status

### Reproduction
[comment]: # (Describe how we can replicate the bug step by step.)

- Open Status
- Open the drawer
- Change the status by adding a hashtag
- Play around a bit the red screen should appear imediatly or after a few actions

### Additional Information
[comment]: # (Please do your best to fill this out.)
* Status version: at least since origin/release/0.9.10 
* Operating System: Android emulator, not on device (iOS not tested)

#### Logs

[comment]: # (if on Android please replicate bug whilst running adb logcat)
```
08-17 11:03:23.191  4280  4368 D ReactNativeJS: DEBUG [status-im.utils.handlers:22] - Handling re-frame event:  :my-profile/update-status

08-17 11:03:23.446  4280  4368 E ReactNativeJS: One of the sources for assign has an enumerable key on the prototype chain. Are you trying to assign a prototype property? We don't allow it, as this is an edge case that we do not support. This error is a performance optimization and not spec compliant.
08-17 11:03:23.479  4280  4368 W ReactNativeJS: Warning: performUpdateIfNecessary: Unexpected batch number (current 607, pending 606)

```
First step to fix could be to determine which commit introduced the bug.
